quiz.title: Unit 8 Quiz 2 (AP Calculus)
quiz.subtitle: Integration Techniques
quiz.subject: Calculus
quiz.topic: Integration of Polynomials and Rational Functions

questions.question: Evaluate $\int (3x^2 - 4x + 5) \, dx$
questions.explanation: Integrate term by term: $\int 3x^2 dx = x^3$, $\int -4x dx = -2x^2$, $\int 5 dx = 5x$. Combine: $x^3 - 2x^2 + 5x + C$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int \frac{1}{x^2} \, dx$
questions.explanation: Rewrite as $\int x^{-2} dx$. Using power rule: $\frac{x^{-1}}{-1} + C = -x^{-1} + C = -\frac{1}{x} + C$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int \left(\frac{2}{x} + 3x^2\right) \, dx$
questions.explanation: Integrate term by term: $\int \frac{2}{x} dx = 2\ln|x|$, $\int 3x^2 dx = x^3$. Combine: $2\ln|x| + x^3 + C$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int (x^3 + 4x - 7) \, dx$
questions.explanation: Integrate term by term: $\int x^3 dx = \frac{x^4}{4}$, $\int 4x dx = 2x^2$, $\int -7 dx = -7x$. Combine: $\frac{x^4}{4} + 2x^2 - 7x + C$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int \frac{3}{x^3} \, dx$
questions.explanation: Rewrite as $\int 3x^{-3} dx$. Using power rule: $3 \cdot \frac{x^{-2}}{-2} + C = -\frac{3}{2}x^{-2} + C = -\frac{3}{2x^2} + C$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int (5x^4 - \frac{2}{x^2} + 1) \, dx$
questions.explanation: Integrate term by term: $\int 5x^4 dx = x^5$, $\int -2x^{-2} dx = 2x^{-1} = \frac{2}{x}$, $\int 1 dx = x$. Combine: $x^5 + \frac{2}{x} + x + C$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int \sqrt{x} \, dx$
questions.explanation: Rewrite as $\int x^{1/2} dx$. Using power rule: $\frac{x^{3/2}}{3/2} + C = \frac{2}{3}x^{3/2} + C$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int \frac{x^3 + 2x}{x} \, dx$
questions.explanation: Simplify first: $\frac{x^3 + 2x}{x} = x^2 + 2$. Then integrate: $\int (x^2 + 2) dx = \frac{x^3}{3} + 2x + C$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int (4x^3 - \frac{5}{x} + 3) \, dx$
questions.explanation: Integrate term by term: $\int 4x^3 dx = x^4$, $\int -\frac{5}{x} dx = -5\ln|x|$, $\int 3 dx = 3x$. Combine: $x^4 - 5\ln|x| + 3x + C$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int \left(\frac{1}{x} - \frac{4}{x^3}\right) \, dx$
questions.explanation: Integrate term by term: $\int \frac{1}{x} dx = \ln|x|$, $\int -4x^{-3} dx = -4 \cdot \frac{x^{-2}}{-2} = 2x^{-2} = \frac{2}{x^2}$. Combine: $\ln|x| + \frac{2}{x^2} + C$.

questions.question: Find the function f(x) if $f'(x) = 6x^2 - 4$ and $f(1) = 3$
questions.explanation: Integrate: $f(x) = \int (6x^2 - 4) dx = 2x^3 - 4x + C$. Use $f(1)=3$: $2(1)^3 - 4(1) + C = 3 \Rightarrow -2 + C = 3 \Rightarrow C = 5$. So $f(x) = 2x^3 - 4x + 5$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int \frac{x^4 - 2x^2 + 1}{x^2} \, dx$
questions.explanation: Simplify: $\frac{x^4 - 2x^2 + 1}{x^2} = x^2 - 2 + x^{-2}$. Integrate: $\int x^2 dx = \frac{x^3}{3}$, $\int -2 dx = -2x$, $\int x^{-2} dx = -x^{-1} = -\frac{1}{x}$. Combine: $\frac{x^3}{3} - 2x - \frac{1}{x} + C$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int (2x - 3)^2 \, dx$
questions.explanation: Expand first: $(2x - 3)^2 = 4x^2 - 12x + 9$. Then integrate: $\int 4x^2 dx = \frac{4}{3}x^3$, $\int -12x dx = -6x^2$, $\int 9 dx = 9x$. Combine: $\frac{4}{3}x^3 - 6x^2 + 9x + C$.

questions.question: Evaluate $\int \left(\frac{5}{x} - 3x^4 + \frac{2}{x^5}\right) \, dx$
questions.explanation: Integrate term by term: $\int \frac{5}{x} dx = 5\ln|x|$, $\int -3x^4 dx = -\frac{3}{5}x^5$, $\int 2x^{-5} dx = 2\cdot\frac{x^{-4}}{-4} = -\frac{1}{2}x^{-4} = -\frac{1}{2x^4}$. Combine: $5\ln|x| - \frac{3}{5}x^5 - \frac{1}{2x^4} + C$.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent work! You have mastered integration of polynomials and rational functions.
scoreMessages.70: Good job! You understand most integration techniques. Review the power rule and special cases.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing! Focus on simplifying expressions before integrating and remembering special formulas.
scoreMessages.0: Review the power rule for integration, $\int 1/x dx = \ln|x|$, and how to handle fractional exponents.
